channel.title: Hey just wondering
channel.description: Hey, Is there a way to make your SCAR Script an .exe file?

item.title: Hey just wondering
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Nashi, post:11, topic:118818”]EDIT: Delphi are pro

Woot Woot.

I made, MoveMouse, MoveMouseSmooth, HoldMouse, ReleaseMouse, ClickMouse, Wait, FindColor & GetColour[/quote]

Cruels.net Delphi section has a few SCAR functions in Delphi form, two being MoveMouseSmoothEx and GetPage, you should check them out.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey just wondering
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Well, the most easiest way is to start with Delphi, you should start with re-creating every function and include in SCAR it’s self into a new pascal file, then you can start on things such as includes(includes that use the SCAR function list, it would be mainly copy & paste for includes), then your script would use your SCAR basics and your extra include files, of course you will need someone better than me to explain it more, wait, I’ll draw a simple image.

However, if your looking to convert files such as Rons Keylogger to exe’s so the user is obviously unaware of this, give up, a simple firewall stops you in your tracks, if you manage to figure out how to send the logs to a file. However, if you want to use this on a PC that can’t install SCAR, archive C:\Program Files\SCAR*\ up with something like Winrar, put it on a CD and simply extract to the desktop on the new pc and it should work. There’s no real need for exe’s if you think of it.

However, if you really want to go the extra mile, you’ll expand this so you can “convert” SCAR files into exe’s similar to Java’s compiler converts java into bytecode, minus the obvious multi-platform support.

Read full topic

item.title: Hey just wondering
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

I may be wrong, but to make an auto woodchopper (example), you would probably need to write out your script in Visual Basic, and let the user set the variables in the interface. And you would need to actually include SRL functions directly in your script.

Thats just a guess though.

Read full topic

It wouldn’t technically be a ‘SCAR’ script anymore.[/quote]i uninstalled VB cause it was taking up space and i couldnt run anyones programs with it.

item.title: Hey just wondering
item.dc:creator: @mod_robby mod robby
item.description:
@mod_robby wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:2, topic:118818”]I’m not sure, but I don’t know why you would want to.

Most people would disregard .exe files claiming to be SCAR compatable. It’s most likely to be a virus.[/quote]
well what i’m going to use it for is making an auto program instead of being a script so that no-one can rip/leech it from me
